column1: 1401|about two o' clock|At about two o' clock the owners young wife came
column2: carrying a handleless cup and a pot with a quilted cover
column3: to where I was still lying disconsolate

column1: 1401|about two o'clock|The next day was Saturday and
column3: I decided to bring the job to its end. So I sent word that I shouldn't be able to umpire for the team at Steeple Sinderby and

column1: 1401|one minute past two|The express departed from Birmingham with the nicest exactitude
column2: and covered itself with glory as far as Watford
column3: when it ran into a mist
column4: and lost more than a quarter of an hour
column5: besides ruining Arthur's career. Arthur arrived in London at one minute past two.
